title: The tank item that needs to exist (in regards to balance between incomming damage types)
body:
There needs to be an item available that accomplishes the following:

+25 flat Armor, +25 flat Magic Resist
+300 HP
Unique Passive: Balanced Defense -
Gain Armor equal to 15% of your purchased Magic Resist.
Gain Magic Resist equal to 15% of your purchased Armor.

Keep in mind these numbers are completely irrelevant and should certainly be changed for the sake of Balance, I just gave specific values to paint a clearer picture of what I mean.

Generally speaking, the greater the mix of damage types from the enemy team, the less effective tanks wind up being later on in the game. Considering they have to split their gold into both MR and Armor, as well as HP, they tend to fall off every time they buy an item that grants a resist that doesn't apply to the opposite damage type enemy carry. Meanwhile the damage dealers have a very simple build path; More Damage. It's really simple for them, regardless of if they are AP or AD, and they scale at a steady rate regardless of comps.

Basically, the item is intended to assist a tank late game, when they have stacked one mitigation type, and then they find themselves -needing- a little bit of the other resist as well. The item is cost inefficient early on, as the unique passive will do close to nothing, however when a tank has +250 armor from items, they can get +37.5 MR from the passive  (+the flat value) to help against those Corki rockets and Support Morg damage, they can get it cost effectively while still being able to gain even more armor / HP for that Riven Top, Lee jungle, and Zed mid, etc etc. The goal of the item is to only be efficient very late game, and to allow an Armor stacked, or MR stacked tank to cover the other neglected stat, and as such, scale appropriately into late game.

Thoughts?

Remember, the stats suggested are just an example so you can understand the purpose of the item, the important thing is the item concept.

What he means is that this item in particular would be a must buy on every single tank because all tanks want both stats. Guardian angel gives mixed stats, but *doesn't* scale off of itself like this item would. An item that scales off of itself like this would become just as restrictive to build diversity as IE is for ADCs at the moment; IE multiplies with itself and all of you other items when playing ADC, and that makes it a must buy, for any champion who would use it effectively. This not only squashes build diversity (Rush IE, maybe built after Trinity force on some occasions, but always early), but also champion diversity (Basically, any ADC who can't effectively rush an IE or a Trinity force becomes comparatively weak). Tanks already have a hard time in the meta right now, and adding a must buy item that is both so good as an item and so bad for diversity would limit it even more. The idea of giving a tank some sort of multiplicative gain from an item is fine, and probably would help a lot, however, an item that scales off of itself in this particular way is not what tanks really need right now.
If you are relying on % increase on an item to balance tanks, you are going to end up disproportionately favoring tanks with big defensive actives.

Meanwhile Leona gets an extra 10+ AR/MR from her W along with health that further amplifies any later purchases. Thereby allowing her to hit some very dependable resists for mid-game engages simply by having this item along with boots and one resist item of choice.

**This lack of specialisation is the source of the tank frustration I think. **Tanks are getting killed not by specialised tank-busters, but by generic damage-dealers. (See below my reasoning)

Armor has to be incredibely efficient for a tank to stand a chance against an adc (which they don't). Adcs scale with ad/as/crit/arpen, whereas tanks only scale with armor/health against this and also have to buy mr. Lategame, tanks just don't stand a chance, but due to the scaling of the adc, early- and midgame tanks do just fine. Only exceptions to this are tanks that can add a scaler to their resistances (Maokai ult for example). 
Other tanks just have to tank the adc by not getting right-clicked for a total of five seconds.

This would be fine if adcs would actually just be the counter to a tank. What they really are is the best and most reliable damage-dealer lategame if given five uninterrupted seconds. They kill tanks by brute damage more than anything.

I'm personally not 100% convinced that tanks need a super powerful late game item right now. I think that a double resist item should be geared more towards early game, as a late game tank with 4K hp and 150 MR can mostly just ignore most mages, making armour stack into the late game more effective. This 150 MR is the investmen of a locket or a Spirit Visage and runes in most cases, and their other effects probably make them better in the late game unless you're a Ramus or something.

The early resists should help stop you just exploding in early fights before you get a ton of items, it won't make your early fighting Lee Sin levels but it will help you at least be tankier than him.

And Last Whisper/Void staff making tanks 35% less tanky is not unreasonably broken?

If that's the counter argument then the issue isn't tank itemization at all but rather % pen being overtuned. Which is definitely false as well. 35% pen isn't enough to straight break a tank. The tank will still be able to function as a tank but with less potency towards attacks from welders of the item which would amount to the biggest damage dealers on the other team meaning that their adc/mage is focusing their dps on your team's tank instead of the rest of your team. And while sure they can still kill the tank 35% faster that's still more than enough time for your team to make use of.

So thanks for the downs and all but no, last whisper is not op and yes, a 20% or higher increase to resistance stats from an item with decent resistance stats of its own is broken.

Honestly, the problem has never been 'tank itemization' on its own or 'damage itemization' on its own, it's the interaction between the two. As I've heard, S2 had problems with tank itemization being too strong, while now we're in the reverse of that- damage is everywhere and gives increasing returns on investment via the crit/attack speed/AD/ArPen compounding to increase damages further and further. On the flip side, Tank items give diminishing returns- the first 100 armor you get decreases damage to 50%. However, to halve the damage once more to 25% takes twice that amount- and Last Whisper will cut that to 33% damage. I.E. (Assuming both have 1-2 items) an adc can double their average dps by buying a Phantom Dancer. However, for a tank to double their durability (just vs. ad, no AP included, and with an armor item to bring 100 armor total) would have to buy a thornmail and a frozen heart- and if the ADC buys a LW, one of those items is ***completely negated.***

**tl;dr**- the reason tanks and dps aren't balanced is because damage dealers get compounding returns while tanks get diminishing returns.

NOTE: the heavily diminishing returns of defense is actually what promotes the bruisers- double-dipping is more efficient than getting more tankiness- the only way to counter this is to make tank items synergize with each other to make them more efficient to go full tank.

On another note, I know that offense needs to be > defense, but it should be at least a bit more even than it is now.
